page.title: 05Dairy Farming round Kingsley
page.content: Mr Clowes and Mr Fallows are ordinary dairy farmers. Their working day normally starts at 6.30 am when they milk the cows. That takes until 9.0 am. They are both very busy because Mr Clowes has 55 cows and Mr Fallows 107. After milking they feed the animals. Next the farmer has his breakfast. The rest of the day is spent on maintenance, cleaning, spreading manure, cutting and baling hay or spraying against weed. The hay harvest is the busiest time of the year. Evening milking starts at 4.30 pm, and the working day ends at about 9.0 pm. Mr Clowes has been a farmer for 16 years and he bought his 100-acre farm. Mr Fallows has 400 acres on two sites which he took over from his father when he retired.
